revised_title: Cyclic Group Actions and Knots: Exploring Inequivalent Actions and Branched Cyclic Covers
tldr: The authors investigate the existence of infinitely many inequivalent cyclic group actions on knots and the related problem of whether distinct knots can arise as the branched cyclic covers of a given knot. They use algebraic techniques, including results on logarithmic forms, to study the homological invariants of knots and establish criteria for the number of distinct knots that can be generated by cyclic group actions.
